title: System Information Commands
content: System Information Commands systeminfo msinfo32 dxdiag winver Provides a detailed summary of the computer's hardware and software configuration. Opens the System Information graphical utility, which provides comprehensive technical details about the system. Launches the DirectX Diagnostic Tool, used to troubleshoot video and sound card problems. Displays the About Windows dialog box, showing the specific Windows version and build number.

title: File & Directory Commands
content: File & Directory Commands File & Directory Management mkdir md echo dir attrib Displays or changes file attributes. You can manage Read-only (R), Archive (A), System (S), and Hidden (H) attributes. Use /s to process files in all directories in the specified path. Use /d to also process folders. Make Directory. Creates a new folder. Creates a new text file and writes text to it. Displays a list of files and subdirectories in a directory. You can search for specific file types.

title: Disk Management Commands
content: Disk Management Commands General CMD Commands format vol label Diskpart General Disk Management List & Select Create & Format Partitions Modify & Delete Partitions Information Commands Diskpart VHD Management create vdisk select vdisk attach vdisk expand vdisk detach vdisk Creating a Bootable USB Drive active clean convert gpt convert mbr

title: Drive Maintenance Commands
content: Drive Maintenance Commands chkdsk defrag Checks a disk for file system errors and bad sectors and attempts to repair them. Analyzes and defragments files on local volumes to improve system performance.

title: User Management Commands
content: User Management Commands net user lusrmgr.msc Adds, modifies, and removes user accounts. Must be run from an elevated Command Prompt. Opens the Local Users and Groups GUI tool for managing user accounts and group memberships.

title: System Recovery Commands
content: System Recovery Commands sfc bootrec dism rstrui.exe mdsched.exe shutdown /r /o System File Checker. Scans and repairs protected system files. Used to repair boot-related issues like MBR or BCD. Deployment Image Servicing and Management. Can repair the Windows component store. Launches the System Restore utility. Launches the Windows Memory Diagnostic tool. Restarts the computer into the Advanced Startup Options (Windows RE).

title: Device Management
content: Device Manager devmgmt.msc A tool to manage hardware devices and their drivers. You can update, roll back, disable, or uninstall drivers.

title: System Configuration
content: System Configuration sysdm.cpl Opens the System Properties window. From the Advanced tab, you can manage Performance settings (including Virtual Memory) and from the System Protection tab, you can manage System Restore points.

title: System Services & Processes
content: System Services & Processes services.msc taskmgr.exe Opens the Services management console to start, stop, and configure system services. Opens the Task Manager to view and manage running applications, background processes, and system performance.

title: Windows Registry & Event Viewer
content: Windows Registry & Event Viewer regedit.exe eventvwr.msc Opens the Registry Editor to view and edit system-wide configuration settings. Opens the Event Viewer to browse and manage system and application logs.
